Mike Czarny Tinkerer. Hacker. Engineer.

About Me Projects

Background

Originally from Poland, now living in LA (not limited to), I am a systems and network engineer with a passion for building and automating (and all the fun stuff in between). Some would call this DevOps/SysOps/NetOps/SRE. I've had some success in both startup and corporate enviroments having worn many hats during a seven years career. My focus has recently shifted from traditional cloud and bare-metal services to blockchain technology and cryptocurrency, which I see as the next disruptive layers of the internet, and an area that I'm most excited about contributing to.

Systems

I build, scale, automate and monitor infrastructure. Most recently, I did this for MaxCDN's Nginx based bare metal CDN from startup to acquisition by StackPath. Among systems I use frequently are: CentOS, FreeBSD, Ubuntu, Nginx, VM, MySQL, InfluxDB.

Networks

I have experience designing, automating and deploying 1TB+ global anycast and private networks. At my time with MaxCDN, we went from 60 to 600Gbps of capacity to multi Tbps after becoming a part of StackPath. I've worked with and blended most major vendor platforms such as Juniper, Arista, Cisco, HP, Brocade, Opengear.

Tools

Tooling is something I enjoy building, using and documenting. I've built numerous Python and Bash Nagios monitors and created dashboards from ground-up to keep things humming along. The list is long and constantly growing. A few most frequently used are: Python, Bash, SQL, Ansible, Puppet, Nagios, Grafana, Cacti, Git.

Featured Projects

Overseer - Server and Network Monitoring
  • Nagios based - Industry standard
  • Language agnostic
  • Highly customizable

A collection of Python and Bash monitors for Nagios used by high traffic services such as MaxCDN and StackPath.

  • Clean UI

A monitoring stack for anything and everything using InfluxDB, Grafana and Telegraf.
